intro: Physaria okanensis, commonly known as the Okanogan bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and inflated seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a short stature, usually reaching only a few inches in height, and features hairy stems and leaves. Physaria okanensis is adapted to arid environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand drought conditions.
